dict.description:`This module exposes Templat:
description:`This module exposes Templater's running configuration.

This is mostly useful when writing scripts requiring some context information.
`
dict.description:\"The `TFile` object represe: description:"The `TFile` object representing the template file."
description:"The `TFile` object representing the target file where the template will be inserted."
dict.description:\"The `RunMode`, representin: description:"The `RunMode`, representing the way Templater was launched (Create new from template, Append to active file, ...)."
dict.description:\"The active file (if existi: description:"The active file (if existing) when launching Templater."
dict.description:\"This module contains every: description:"This module contains every internal function related to dates."
dict.description:'The format for the date. De: description:'The format for the date. Defaults to `"YYYY-MM-DD"`. Refer to [format reference](https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/).'
dict.description:\"Duration to offset the dat: description:"Duration to offset the date from. If a number is provided, duration will be added to the date in days. You can also specify the offset as a string using the ISO 8601 format."
description:"The date referential, e.g. set this to the note's title."
dict.description:\"The format for the referen: description:"The format for the reference date. Refer to [format reference](https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/)."
dict.description:\"Week day number. If the lo: description:"Week day number. If the locale assigns Monday as the first day of the week, `0` will be Monday, `-7` will be last week's day."
dict.description:\"This module contains every: description:"This module contains every internal function related to files."
dict.description:\"The string contents of the: description:"The string contents of the file at the time that Templater was executed. Manipulating this string will *not* update the current file."
dict.description:\"Creates a new file using a: description:"Creates a new file using a specified template or with a specified content."
dict.description:\"Either the template used f: description:"Either the template used for the new file content, or the file content as a string. If it is the template to use, you retrieve it with `tp.file.find_tfile(TEMPLATENAME)`."
dict.description:'The filename of the new fil: description:'The filename of the new file, defaults to "Untitled".'
dict.description:\"Whether to open or not the: description:"Whether to open or not the newly created file. Warning: if you use this option, since commands are executed asynchronously, the file can be opened first and then other commands are appended to that new file and not the previous file."
dict.description:'The folder to put the new f: description:'The folder to put the new file in, defaults to Obsidian\'
dict.description:'The format for the date. De: description:'The format for the date. Defaults to `"YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm"`. Refer to [format reference](https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/).'
dict.description:`Sets the cursor to this loc:
description:`Sets the cursor to this location after the template has been inserted. 

You can navigate between the different cursors using the configured hotkey in Obsidian settings.
`
dict.description:`The order of the different:
description:`The order of the different cursors jump, e.g. it will jump from 1 to 2 to 3, and so on.
If you specify multiple tp.file.cursor with the same order, the editor will switch to multi-cursor.
`
dict.description:\"Appends some content after: description:"Appends some content after the active cursor in the file."
dict.description:\"The content to append afte: description:"The content to append after the active cursor."
dict.description:\"Check to see if a file exi: description:"Check to see if a file exists by it's file path. The full path to the file, relative to the Vault and containing the extension, must be provided."
dict.description:\"The full file path of the: description:"The full file path of the file we want to check existence for."
dict.description:\"Search for a file and retu: description:"Search for a file and returns its `TFile` instance."
dict.description:\"The filename we want to se: description:"The filename we want to search and resolve as a `TFile`."
dict.description:\"If set to `true`, returns: description:"If set to `true`, returns the vault-absolute path of the folder. If `false`, only returns the basename of the folder (the last part). Defaults to `false`."
dict.description:\"Includes the file's link c: description:"Includes the file's link content. Templates in the included content will be resolved."
dict.description:'The link to the file to inc: description:'The link to the file to include, e.g. `"[[MyFile]]"`, or a TFile object. Also supports sections or blocks inclusions.'
dict.description:\"Retrieves the file's last: description:"Retrieves the file's last modification date."
dict.description:\"Moves the file to the desi: description:"Moves the file to the desired vault location."
dict.description:'The new vault relative path: description:'The new vault relative path of the file, without the file extension. Note: the new path needs to include the folder and the filename, e.g. `"/Notes/MyNote"`.'
dict.description:\"The file to move, defaults: description:"The file to move, defaults to the current file."
dict.description:\"Retrieves the file's absol: description:"Retrieves the file's absolute path on the system."
dict.description:\"If set to `true`, only ret: description:"If set to `true`, only retrieves the vault's relative path."
dict.description:\"Renames the file (keeps th: description:"Renames the file (keeps the same file extension)."
dict.description:\"Retrieves the active file': description:"Retrieves the active file's text selection."
dict.description:\"Retrieves the file's tags: description:"Retrieves the file's tags (array of string)."
dict.description:\"This modules exposes all t: description:"This modules exposes all the frontmatter variables of a file as variables."
dict.description:\"This module exposes hooks: description:"This module exposes hooks that allow you to execute code when a Templater event occurs."
dict.description:\"Hooks into when all active: description:"Hooks into when all actively running templates have finished executing. Most of the time this will be a single template, unless you are using `tp.file.include` or `tp.file.create_new`.\n\nMultiple invokations of this method will have their callback functions run in parallel."
dict.description:\"Callback function that wil: description:"Callback function that will be executed when all actively running templates have finished executing."
dict.description:\"This module exposes all th: description:"This module exposes all the functions and classes from the Obsidian API."
dict.description:\"This module contains syste: description:"This module contains system related functions."
dict.description:\"Spawns a prompt modal and: description:"Spawns a prompt modal and returns the user's input."
dict.description:\"Text placed above the inpu: description:"Text placed above the input field."
dict.description:\"A default value for the in: description:"A default value for the input field."
dict.description:\"Throws an error if the pro: description:"Throws an error if the prompt is canceled, instead of returning a `null` value."
dict.description:\"If set to `true`, the inpu: description:"If set to `true`, the input field will be a multiline textarea. Defaults to `false`."
dict.description:\"Spawns a suggester prompt: description:"Spawns a suggester prompt and returns the user's chosen item."
dict.description:\"Array of strings represent: description:"Array of strings representing the text that will be displayed for each item in the suggester prompt. This can also be a function that maps an item to its text representation."
dict.description:\"Array containing the value: description:"Array containing the values of each item in the correct order."
dict.description:\"Limit the number of items: description:"Limit the number of items rendered at once (useful to improve performance when displaying large lists)."
dict.description:\"This modules contains ever: description:"This modules contains every internal function related to the web (making web requests)."
dict.description:\"Retrieves and parses the d: description:"Retrieves and parses the daily quote from the API `https://api.quotable.io` as a callout."
dict.description:\"Limits selection to photos: description:"Limits selection to photos matching a search term. Multiple search terms can be passed separated by a comma."
dict.description:\"Optional argument to inclu: description:"Optional argument to include the specified size in the image link markdown. Defaults to false."
dict.description:\"Makes a HTTP request to th: description:"Makes a HTTP request to the specified URL. Optionally, you can specify a path to extract specific data from the response."
dict.description:\"The URL to which the HTTP: description:"The URL to which the HTTP request will be made."
dict.description:\"A path within the response: description:"A path within the response JSON to extract specific data."
dict..setDesc(\"Files in this folder will be: .setDesc("Files in this folder will be available as templates.")
dict..setDesc(\"Maximum timeout in seconds fo: .setDesc("Maximum timeout in seconds for a system command.")
dict..setDesc(\"If you like this Plugin, cons: .setDesc("If you like this Plugin, consider donating to support continued development.")
dict..append(\"Templater provides multiples p: .append("Templater provides multiples predefined variables / functions that you can use.",e.createEl("br"),"Check the ",e.createEl("a",{href:"https://silentvoid13.github.io/Templater/",text:"documentation"})," to get a list of all the available internal variables / functions.")
dict..append(\"Adds syntax highlighting for T: .append("Adds syntax highlighting for Templater commands in edit mode.")
.append("Adds syntax highlighting for Templater commands in edit mode on mobile. Use with caution: this may break live preview on mobile platforms.")
dict..append(\"Automatically triggers \",e.cr: .append("Automatically triggers ",e.createEl("code",{text:"tp.file.cursor"})," after inserting a template.",e.createEl("br"),"You can also set a hotkey to manually trigger ",e.createEl("code",{text:"tp.file.cursor"}),".")
dict..append(\"Template hotkeys allows you to: .append("Template hotkeys allows you to bind a template to a hotkey.")
dict..append(\"Startup templates are template: .append("Startup templates are templates that will get executed once when Templater starts.",e.createEl("br"),"These templates won't output anything.",e.createEl("br"),"This can be useful to set up templates adding hooks to Obsidian events for example.")
dict..append(\"All JavaScript files in this f: .append("All JavaScript files in this folder will be loaded as CommonJS modules, to import custom user functions.",e.createEl("br"),"The folder needs to be accessible from the vault.",e.createEl("br"),"Check the ",e.createEl("a",{href:"https://silentvoid13.github.io/Templater/",text:"documentation"})," for more information.")
dict..append(\"Allows you to create user func: .append("Allows you to create user functions linked to system commands.",e.createEl("br"),e.createEl("b",{text:"Warning: "}),"It can be dangerous to execute arbitrary system commands from untrusted sources. Only run system commands that you understand, from trusted sources.")
dict..append(\"Templater will listen for the: .append("Templater will listen for the new file creation event, and, if it matches a rule you've set, replace every command it finds in the new file's content. ","This makes Templater compatible with other plugins like the Daily note core plugin, Calendar plugin, Review plugin, Note refactor plugin, etc. ",e.createEl("br"),e.createEl("br"),"Make sure to set up rules under either Folder Templates or File Regex Template below.",e.createEl("br"),e.createEl("br"),e.createEl("b",{text:"Warning: "}),"This can be dangerous if you create new files with unknown / unsafe content on creation. Make sure that every new file's content is safe on creation.")
dict..append(\"File Regex Templates are trigg: .append("File Regex Templates are triggered when a new ",e.createEl("strong",{text:"empty"})," file is created that matches one of them. Templater will fill the empty file with the specified template."
dict.,\"The deepest match is used. A global d: ,"The deepest match is used. A global default template would be defined on the root "
dict..append(\"When enabled, Templater will m: .append("When enabled, Templater will make use of the folder templates defined below. This option is mutually exclusive with File Regex Templates below, so enabling one will disable the other.")
dict..append(\"File Regex Templates are trigg: .append("File Regex Templates are triggered when a new ",e.createEl("strong",{text:"empty"})," file is created that matches one of them. Templater will fill the empty file with the specified template.",e.createEl("br"),"The first match from the top is used, so the order of the rules is important.",e.createEl("br"),"Use ",e.createEl("code",{text:".*"})," as a final catch-all, if you need it.")
dict..append(\"When enabled, Templater will m: .append("When enabled, Templater will make use of the file regex templates defined below. This option is mutually exclusive with Folder Templates above, so enabling one will disable the other.")
dict..append(\"Folder Templates are triggered: .append("Folder Templates are triggered when a new ",e.createEl("strong",{text:"empty "}),"file is created in a given folder."
dict.,\"Templater will fill the empty file wi: ,"Templater will fill the empty file with the specified template."
dict.,\"The first match from the top is used,: ,"The first match from the top is used, so the order of the rules is important."
dict.,\"Use \",e.createEl(\"code\",{text:\".*: ,"Use ",e.createEl("code",{text:".*"})," as a final catch-all, if you need it.")
